ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Don't take the first half if you took MBB's Macro course - it's all redundantSecond half of the class is a nice summary of the pharmacological relevance of structural biology, which could be useful when thinking about future careers.
I would say it is a very valuable course if you are planning on studying pharmacology.
Good introduction to various techniques used in pharmaclogy and the current problems of interest.
I would recommend it if they are interested in this subject or it is likely that their research will be related to the material, but otherwise I would not. I was not very satisfied with this course.
I would definitely recommend the course, but only for somebody very interested in this field. The material is somewhat dense and confusing, but if you enjoy it then it's a great course!

I would recommend it to anyone looking for a practical understanding of pharmacology research. It overlaps greatly with the MBB course on Macromolecular Biophysics but the practical portion of crystallography was only covered in Pharm 529, making this course very useful.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It gave me a bit more information on what each professor studies than what I gleamed from interview weekend and orientation week. Other than that, it was not very helpful.
Provided me with real world practical applications of structural biology beyond basic science, will be great for grant writing, etc.
It gave me an understanding of different approaches to structural biology, particularly in the field of pharmacology.
Practical understanding of crystallography and cryo-EM which is useful for research
